headlines.title: NATO Mounts First Coordinated Response After Suspected Sabotage Severs Baltic Sea Cable
headlines.summary: NATO launches its inaugural coordinated operation following the severing of a deep-sea communications cable in the Baltic Sea amid sabotage suspicions. Critical European infrastructure faces hybrid threats from potential adversaries like Russia. Alliance bolsters defenses; investigations identify culprits. Signals rising tensions over undersea assets vital to global connectivity.

headlines.title: US Forces Capture Third Venezuelan Oil Tanker as Trump Claims Receipt of 80 Million Barrels
headlines.summary: US military seizes a third tanker carrying Venezuelan oil in the Indian Ocean weeks after departure from Venezuelan waters; Trump states US has received 80 million barrels total. Venezuela loses key revenue amid sanctions; affects global oil markets. Further seizures possible as US enforces restrictions on Maduro regime oil exports.

headlines.title: Drones Launch Intensified Attacks on Sudan's Kordofan Gold and Oil Region
headlines.summary: Unidentified drones strike Sudan's Kordofan region, a key gold and oil area, causing mass casualties and escalating the new frontline between Sudanese army and paramilitaries. Thousands displaced; peace efforts stalled. Controls resource revenues funding war; risks broader instability and humanitarian catastrophe in Africa.

headlines.title: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz Arrives in Beijing for Economic Talks
headlines.summary: Chancellor Merz lands in China for his inaugural visit, prioritizing German economic interests alongside discussions on Beijing's Moscow ties and European relations. German firms seek market access amid trade tensions. Strengthens bilateral dialogue; impacts EU-China strategy and global supply chains.

headlines.title: Louvre Director Laurence des Cars Resigns After Crown Jewels Heist
headlines.summary: Louvre director steps down amid scandals including October's crown jewels theft, labor strikes, leaks and scams. Museum visitors and staff affected; security overhaul needed. Tarnishes France's cultural flagship; prompts reforms at world's most-visited museum drawing 9 million annually.

headlines.title: Sri Lanka Arrests Former Intelligence Chief Suresh Sallay Over 2019 Easter Attacks
headlines.summary: Police detain ex-intelligence head Sallay for aiding the bombings that killed nearly 300 on Easter Sunday 2019. Victims' families and Muslim community seek justice. Trial uncovers lapses; bolsters accountability for one of nation's deadliest assaults.

headlines.title: ICC Charges Rodrigo Duterte Over Deadly Philippines Drug War
headlines.summary: Former President Duterte faces trial at The Hague for his drug war killing thousands since 2016. Victims' kin and human rights groups pursue redress; operations continue locally. Sets precedent for prosecuting extrajudicial killings; strains Philippines international ties.

headlines.title: Seoul Court Convicts Shaman of Bribery Linked to Ex-First Lady Kim Keon-hee
headlines.summary: Shaman Jeon Seong-bae guilty of channeling bribes and gifts between Kim and Unification Church figures. Impacts South Korean politics amid Yoon scandals. Further probes likely; erodes public trust in elite institutions.

headlines.title: Trump Delivers Longest State of the Union Address in Decades at 100 Minutes
headlines.summary: President Trump sets record with speech exceeding 100 minutes, surpassing Clinton's mark, while honoring men's hockey team amid women's team controversy. Congress and public receive agenda. Shapes 2026 policy priorities; highlights administration achievements and divisions.

headlines.title: Rwanda-Backed Rebels Spark Gunfire and Shelling in Congo's Goma Sheltering 1 Million Displaced
headlines.summary: Rebels overrun troops prompting gunfire and shelling in Goma; UN estimates over 1 million displaced now inside the safe-haven aid hub. Civilians face acute risks; aid strained. Threatens regional stability in eastern Congo.
headlines.previousContext: Residents report gunfire and shelling after entry; UN raises displaced in city to over 1 million

headlines.title: Palestinians Cross Military Zone on Foot to Return to Northern Gaza
headlines.summary: Displaced Gazans stream back north after Israel opens bisecting zone post-hostage deal. Hundreds of thousands affected by prior evacuation; rebuilding starts. Eases humanitarian strain but fighting persists.
headlines.previousContext: Thousands return on foot following allowance to cross zone
